features.featureDescription: Azure Role-Based Access Control (Azure RBAC) can be used to managed access to service's data plane actions.
features.featureGuidance: Defender for Cloud uses Azure role-based access control (Azure RBAC) to provide built-in roles. You can assign these roles to users, groups, and services in Azure to give users access to resources according to the access defined in the role. We recommend that you assign the least permissive role needed for users to complete their tasks. For example, assign the Reader role to users who only need to view information about the security health of a resource but not take action, such as applying recommendations or editing policies.
features.customerActionsDescription: Follow just enough administration (least privilege) principle
